duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage day to day operations of our Boston office.
Act as primary contact for landlord and property management.
Handle building related needs and requirements.
Responsible for creating, enforcing, and maintaining office policies, procedures, and safety standards.
Manage all vendor and service provider relationships, including coordinating with existing providers and researching new solutions.
Help facilitate the future of work strategy.
Monitor federal, state, and local guidelines.
Partner with the People Operations and Employee Experience teams to facilitate employee events, company meetings, lunch & learns, customer meet-ups, etc.
Maintain the overall appearance, maintenance, organization, and cleanliness of the office.
Utilize building ticketing system to place maintenance and building support requests.
Oversee inventory and supply management of office supplies, cleaning supplies, bathroom supplies, PPE, etc.
Manage in-office food and beverage programs.
Oversee building access process and ensure access cards are being created properly.
Oversee and mentor a team of office coordinators.
Manage office improvement efforts including small office build-outs and procurement of office equipment.
Monitor office utilization and coordinate with Talent Acquisition on new hire projections to ensure proper capacity planning and space optimization.
Assist security in ensuring the office remains safe and secure.
Be an ambassador of company culture and values.

education_certification.credential: 3-5+ years of office, facilities, or property management experience. Bachelor's degree in related field preferred.
